My uncle smiled and said that I

which put an end to the conversation

And now I must tell you a little
story that will please you. Do you
not remember Justine ?
Moritz?
Perhaps you do not I will therefore
tell you her story in a few words. Mad.
Martin her Mother was a widow with
four children of whom Justine
was the third. This girl had always been
the favourite of her father
butthro an odd perversity her Mother
could ^not endure her and after the
death of M. Moritz treated her very ill.
My aunt observed this, and when Justine
was twelve years old too prevailed
on her mother to allow her to live
at our house.X
